Usca Ria LLC Sells 1,036 Shares of Ryanair Holdings plc ( RYAAY )
Usca Ria LLC Sells 1,036 Shares of Ryanair Holdings plc (RYAAY)
American Banking and Market News
August 17, 2018 Friday
Copyright 2018 American Banking and Market News All Rights Reserved
Length: 723 words
Body
Ryanair logo Usca Ria LLC reduced its position in  Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) by 4.3% in the 2nd 
quarter, according to the company in its most recent 13F filing with the SEC. The fund owned 23,192 shares of the 
transportation company's stock after selling 1,036 shares during the quarter. Usca Ria LLC's holdings in Ryanair 
were worth $2,649,000 at the end of the most recent reporting period.  
A number of other hedge funds and other institutional investors have also recently bought and sold shares of 
RYAAY. Baillie Gifford & Co. grew its holdings in  Ryanair by 2.3% in the 2nd quarter. Baillie Gifford & Co. now 
owns 5,936,962 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $678,179,000 after buying an additional 
133,294 shares in the last quarter.  WCM Investment Management CA grew its holdings in  Ryanair by 5.2% in the 
1st quarter. WCM Investment Management CA now owns 3,719,251 shares of the transportation company's stock 
valued at $456,910,000 after buying an additional 185,253 shares in the last quarter.  Massachusetts Financial 
Services Co. MA grew its holdings in  Ryanair by 14.5% in the 2nd quarter. Massachusetts Financial Services Co. 
MA now owns 2,539,197 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $290,053,000 after buying an 
additional 321,859 shares in the last quarter.  Royal Bank of Canada grew its holdings in  Ryanair by 9.6% in the 
1st quarter. Royal Bank of Canada now owns 2,018,166 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at 
$247,932,000 after buying an additional 176,959 shares in the last quarter.  Finally, Thornburg Investment

Southend pins growth hopes on budget airlines
Southend pins growth hopes on budget airlines
City A.M.
August 17, 2018 Friday
Edition 1, National Edition
Copyright 2018 City A.M. All Rights Reserved
Section: NEWS; Pg. 10
Length: 333 words
Byline: ALEXANDRA ROGERS
Body
LONDON Southend Airport has said it intends to double its passenger numbers next year with the arrival of boosted 
numbers from budget carriers Easyjet and Ryanair.
Glyn Jones, chief executive of Stobart Aviation, which operates London Southend, told City A.M. that the airport is 
confident of doubling the growth rate by 2019. It has already boasted a 30 per cent increase in the number of 
passengers earlier this year, "We've also already seen a circa 30 per cent increase in passenger numbers earlier 
this year, making us London's fastest-growing airport," Jones said.
"With Easyjet expecting to fly over 1m passengers for the first time this year, and the arrival of Ryanair flights 
expected to bring over 1m passengers next year, we are confident we can double that growth rate in 2019, putting 
us firmly on track to serve 5m passengers a year by 2022."
Jones pointed to the airport's increasing popularity with passengers outside the usual hub of North Lon-don and 
Essex to other areas of London. Around 25 per cent of its passenger intake now comes from central London, 21 per 
cent from the Docklands areas and 14 per cent from the City.
"We are increasingly finding business passengers are coming from central London as they want to minimise the 
amount of time they spend waiting to fly. A number of airports need you to get to the airport hours before the 
scheduled time of departure.
"You can get here from Liverpool Street direct in 52 minutes, making it a hassle-free journey for City workers 
wanting to jet off to Geneva, Ibiza, Dublin or any of the other 30-plus routes we offer."
Southend pins growth hopes on budget airlines
London Southend has been on an expansion drive over the past year. Last October it applied to extend both ends 
of the terminal building, with construction due to begin this November.
Earlier this year it launched its private jet centre after tapping into what has become a lucrative London market. 
Jones said it recorded around 1,000 private jet movements in July alone, the same number for the whole of last 
year.
Load-Date: August 17, 2018
End of Document
Flight rights group takes Ryanair to court over strike compensation
Flight rights group takes Ryanair to court over strike compensation
Business World (Digest)
August 16, 2018 Thursday
Copyright 2018 Media World Ltd. All Rights Reserved
Section: IRELAND
Length: 313 words
Byline: Business World
Body
German passenger rights company Flightright is taking Ryanair to court over whether it should pay financial 
compensation to passengers affected by strikes at Europe's largest low-cost carrier.
Ryanair had to cancel around 1 in 6 flights on Friday due to a walk-out by pilots in five European countries, 
disrupting an estimated 55,000 travellers.
The worst affected country was Germany, where 250 flights were cancelled, affecting around 42,000 passengers.
EU rules state that passengers can claim monetary compensation of up to 400 euros for flights within the region for 
cancelled or delayed flights, unless the reason is extraordinary circumstances, such as bad weather.
Strikes have generally fallen under extraordinary circumstances although a ruling by the European Court of Justice 
in April said that a wildcat strike by staff at German airline TUIfly following a restructuring could not be classed as 
extraordinary circumstances. Flightright said it believes Ryanair is therefore obliged to pay monetary compensation 
to customers and so has filed a complaint with a court in Frankfurt in a bid to clarify the rules around strikes.
A spokeswoman for the court said she was aware of the Flightright statement, but that she had not yet seen the 
complaint.
Ryanair said it fully complies with the European legislation on the matter, known as EU261.
"Under EU261 legislation, no compensation is payable when the union is acting unreasonably and totally beyond 
the airline's control. If this was within our control, there would be no cancellations," a spokesman said.
Flight rights group takes Ryanair to court over strike compensation
Passenger rights groups such as Flightright help passengers to claim compensation from airlines under EU261 
rules but in exchange for a share of the compensation received.
Many European airlines, including Ryanair, therefore urge passengers to file claims with them directly instead. 
(Reuters)
Source:www.businessworld.ie
Load-Date: September 11, 2018
End of Document
Head to Head Survey: Deutsche Lufthansa (DLAKY) & Ryanair ( RYAAY )
Head to Head Survey: Deutsche Lufthansa (DLAKY) & Ryanair (RYAAY)
American Banking and Market News
August 16, 2018 Thursday

Body
Deutsche Lufthansa (NASDAQ: RYAAY ) and Ryanair (           NASDAQ:RYAAY ) are both large-cap transportation 
companies, but which is the better investment? We will contrast the two businesses based on the strength of their 
valuation, profitability, risk, analyst recommendations, institutional ownership, dividends and earnings.

Dividends
Deutsche Lufthansa pays an annual dividend of $0.67 per share and has a dividend yield of 2.5%. Ryanair does not 
pay a dividend. Deutsche Lufthansa pays out 11.8% of its earnings in the form of a dividend.

Summary
Ryanair beats Deutsche Lufthansa on 8 of the 13 factors compared between the two stocks. 
Deutsche Lufthansa Company Profile
Deutsche Lufthansa logo Deutsche Lufthansa AG operates as an aviation company in Germany and internationally. 
It operates through Network Airlines, Point-to-Point Airlines, Logistics, MRO, Catering segments. The Network 
Airlines segment offers passenger services through a route network of 263 destinations in 86 countries. The Point-
to-Point Airlines segment provides passenger services through a route network of 192 destinations in 62 countries. 
The Logistics segment offers a range of cargo transport services for various cargos, including live animals, valuable 
cargo, mail, dangerous goods, and temperature-sensitive cargo. This segment serves approximately 300 
destinations in approximately 100 countries. The MRO segment provides maintenance, repair, and overhaul 
services for civilian commercial aircraft. It serves airlines and aircraft leasing companies, operators of VIP jets, and 
public-sector clients. The Catering segment offers catering, in-flight sales and in-flight entertainment, in-flight 
service equipment, and the associated logistics, as well as consulting services and operating airport lounges. The 
company also provides consulting and IT services for the aviation industry; training courses in simulator training, 
emergency and service drill, and e-learning; business travel management solutions in the area of payment and 
analysis of corporate travel; and aviation and transport insurance products, as well as insurance brokerage, 
reinsurance, and risk management services. As of December 31, 2017, it had a fleet of 728 aircraft. Deutsche 
Lufthansa AG is headquartered in Cologne, Germany. 
Ryanair Company Profile
Ryanair logo Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in 
Ireland, the United Kingdom, continental Europe, Morocco, and Israel. It also offers various ancillary services, such 
as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; and markets accommodation services and travel 
insurance through its Website, as well as engages in the in-flight sale of beverages, food, and merchandise. In 
addition, the company sells bus and rail tickets onboard its aircraft and through its Website; and markets car 
parking, attractions, and activities, as well as gift vouchers through its Website. It operates a fleet of 350 Boeing 
737-800 aircraft and 33 leased aircraft; and offers approximately 2,000 scheduled short-haul flights per day serving 
approximately 200 airports primarily in Europe. The company was founded in 1985 and is headquartered in Swords, 
Ireland.

End of Document

an average rating of "Hold" and an average price target of $138.00.

firm had revenue of $1.62 billion during the quarter, compared to analyst estimates of $1.56 billion. Ryanair had a 
net margin of 18.47% and a return on equity of 29.19%.  analysts predict that  Ryanair will post 6.28 earnings per 
share for the current year.

About Ryanair
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, continental Europe, Morocco, and Israel. It also offers various ancillary services, such as non-flight 
scheduled services and Internet-related services; and markets accommodation services and travel insurance 
through its Website, as well as engages in the in-flight sale of beverages, food, and merchandise. 
See Also: NASDAQ
